sentences.sentence: Monday, November 23, 2020 NEWSLETTER   by in 0 0 0 0 SHARES 8k VIEWS Beginning Thursday, pharmacies, clinics, etc.
in Ohio, are prohibited from dispensing or promoting the malaria drug hydroxychloroquine, to help treat patients suffering from the Chinese CV-19 virus.
It’s getting out of hand.
The Left is now banning the use of the drug that so many doctors have said work as a treatment to CV-19.
Hydroxychloroquine has been used for 70 years for Malaria and Lupus patients and for many other diseases, and it’s very well known to be a stable drug .
Mike DeWine is the Ohio governor.
He’s a Republican, but he’s a RINO at best.
How a Republican governor could allow leftists to block the use of a drug that hundreds of doctors use to treat their patients who come down with CV-19.
On Wednesday, state regulations were updated to reflect the change but additionally included a number of caveats.
For example, if the prescription is for a pet or whether it is a part of a clinical trial to assess the effectiveness of the drug when used to fight CV-19.
So the Left cares more about your dog getting well than humans.

“No prescription for chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine may be dispensed by a pharmacist or sold at retail by a licensed terminal distributor of dangerous drugs, including prescriptions for patients residing in Ohio dispensed or sold at retail by nonresident terminal distributors of dangerous drugs as defined in rule 4729:5-8-01 of the Administrative Code, unless the prescription bears a written diagnosis code from the prescriber or a statement indicating its veterinary medical purpose,” the state website read.

“Prescriptions issued for chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine for prophylactic use related to CV-19 or for the treatment of CV-19 are strictly prohibited unless otherwise approved by the board’s executive director in consultation with the board president, at which time a resolution shall issue,” the statement continued.

“Upon the effective date of this rule, all previous approvals for the use of chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine shall be deemed void and must be approved using the process outlined in this paragraph.” One exception from the Pharmacy Board is that the restriction doesn’t apply to prescriptions that are “issued as part of a documented institutional review board-approved clinical trial to evaluate the safety and efficacy of the drugs to treat CV-19.

Prescriptions must include documentation that the patient is enrolled in a clinical trial.” “Basically, it’s a patient safety issue,” Cameron McNamee, the board’s director of policy and communications told The Columbus Dispatch.
“We’re looking at the best science to determine what’s best for the patients of Ohio.” She’s lying.
They are not looking at the best science when they ban the use of hydroxychloroquine to treat CV-19 patients.
Click this link to read the memo: She additionally stated the decision has nothing to do with President Donald Trump’s public support for the treatment.
Of course it does.
A video was recently live streamed of a summit of doctors from around the world who talked about how the use of hydroxychloroquine has made their CV-19 patients better in record time.

The live stream video featured medical doctors speaking professionally about protocols they have been using to treat their CV-19 patients, and that hydroxychloroquine, a drug that has been around for 70 years, is their go to choice of medicine for those patients suffering from the Chinese virus.
Social media tech giants like Twitter, Facebook and YouTube killed the live stream, claiming that the medical doctors were spreading misinformation.
Tech nerds are claiming that medical doctors, people who went to med school and have practiced medicine in the real world, are spreading misinformation about the use of hydroxychloroquine.
These people are evil to do what they’re doing.
They don’t understand that the Left no longer controls all media.
Social media makes it possible for people to watch and hear the hundreds of medical doctors who say that hydroxychloroquine is safe and effective to use as a protocol to treat CV-19 patients.
Folks, it’s 1984.
They fear monger every day and every night, with Fake News being spread that CV-19 is so dangerous we can’t even reopen states or our schools.
They want you so afraid that you’ll demand vote-by-mail, because that’s how Democrats plan on stealing the November election from President Trump.
Now, starting with Ohio, and I’m sure other states will follow, they have banned the use of the #1 drug, according to medical doctors, used to treat CV-19.
If they get away with this, think about what else they’ll do for political reasons.
You can’t have that heart surgery, because you smoked for years or you didn’t eat well you’re whole life.

We can’t give you that life saving drug, because you’re over 50 and the government needs it for younger people who will pay taxes longer than you, but we do have a suicide pill you can take if you want to stop the pain.
It does in every leftist totalitarian state on the planet.
Here’s how bad it really is.
If I were to write the full name of the Chinese virus, this piece would be removed and we might lose our platform on all the social media sites.

They did the same thing back when the phony impeachment against Trump was being pushed by Democrats and the Fake News media, and if you mentioned the fake whistleblower’s name, they’d de-platform you by removing your page.
It happened to David, and we had to start all over again.

So now, we’re in a world where the Left is telling us that CV-19 is going to ravage our country, even though we’ve gotten through the worst of it and the death numbers have been dropping steadily, but at the same time, they’re telling us we can’t use the best-known drug for treating it.
In June, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) reportedly revoked emergency authorization for the drug which had been prescribed to treat CV-19.
Nonetheless, Trump and others in the medical community have hailed it as a possible cure for CV-19.
After catching some criticism, Trump doubled down on his defense of the drug.
On Tuesday, during a White House press conference, the president said that the drug was “safe,” reminding people of the 14-day period when he took the drug himself earlier this year.
“Many doctors think it’s extremely good, and some people don’t,” Trump said.

“I think it’s become very political.” This information comes only a day after Twitter caught a lot of public backlash for removing that live stream video I already mentioned, that showed a bunch of medical doctors outside the Supreme Court building, giving their own personal testimonials about how their patient regiments of hydroxychloroquine, zinc and Zithromax had netted positive results.
A Twitter consultant advised CNN that the motion was taken “in line with” the tech company’s CV-19 misinformation policy.

One of the doctors, Dr. Stella Immanuel, claimed she treated more than 350 CV-19 patients, some with diabetes and high blood pressure — and not a single one died after being administered hydroxychloroquine, zinc and Zithromax.
My God, we don’t live in the America we grew up in anymore.
The video, which caught a lot of heat on social media by leftists who want Trump to lose reelection, was shared by Trump and his son Don Jr. before it was taken down.
Trump Jr. had some of his Twitter account features disabled because he shared the video and appeared on “Tucker Carlson Tonight” to respond to the tech giant’s decision.
“I’ve been saying this for a long time,” he told Carlson.
“I wrote my first book about justice and censorship coming from the big tech giants from California — as homogenous a group as you could possibly imagine.

If they are censoring my account, they are censoring others and they’ve been trying to do this for a while.” “I’ve been talking about the de-platforming, that demonetization of people that are preaching conservative values,” he said.
“Because you have to note, this never happens to someone saying something that benefits the left.
It only hurts conservatives.” Rich is syndicated opinion columnist for David Harris Jr. and owner of Maga-Chat.com.
He writes about politics, culture, liberty and faith.
MAGA-Chat.com, where free speech is still free.
